VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Rebuild Your Product Index to Include New Fields

Deliver a better user experience on the Product List page version 2.0 with a flatter data structure for the CC Product Index object. Your buyers can now enjoy faster loading and rendering of product data, which helps them browse your products and place orders more efficiently.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Who: This change only applies to storefronts using the Product List page version 2.0.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, the CC Product Index object collated product data for displaying results on the Product List page version 2.0. The CC Product Index object included lookup relationships to relevant products and categories, and referenced date and sequence fields from those records. This design caused database table joins that sometimes affected performance when loading content on the Product List page.

How: The CC Product Index object now includes fields copied from relevant CC Product, CC Category, and CC Product Category records when the product index is built:

Category
Category End Date
Category Start Date
Product Category End Date
Product Category Sequence
Product Category Start Date
Product End Date
Product Start Date
Product Status
Storefront
IMPORTANT After you upgrade the managed package, your existing Product List page version 2.0 doesn't function correctly until you build a new product index. Go to CC Admin | Global Settings | Indexing and build a new product index. Depending on the complexity of product data on your storefront, the product index build job can take several hours or longer to complete.

The ccrz.ccLogicPICreate class is updated to include these new fields on the CC Product Index object. If you previously extended this class or the default ccrz__E_ProductIndex__c object, update your subscriber code to account for these changes.
